intro: Angraecopsis stellata, commonly known as the star orchid, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in areas with high humidity and bright, indirect light. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with a distinctive central boss of petals. Angraecopsis stellata is a perennial herb that produces its blooms during the rainy season.
